articles.title: Jim Cramer Says Customers Can Buy 60-Inch TV At Walmart For $289 Than Apple Vision Pro: 'Don't Think People Have $4,000 Sitting Around'
articles.content:
"Mad Money" host Jim Cramer thinks Apple Vision Pro might not be everyone's cup of tea because of its price tag, just as Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) has opened pre-orders of its next big bet. What Happened: Cramer agreed with co-host and CNBC's market analyst David Faber, who underscored the fact that a $4,000 product might not have too many buyers. "It's a $4,000 product. That is not something that is going to be widely purchased," said Faber. Cramer agreed with him, even jokingly pointing out that he had to turn down a unit that was being sent to him because it was "too expensive." $AAPL's Vision Pro is now available for pre-opens – @jimcramer, @davidfaber and @carlquintanilla share their experiences with the $3,499 headset thus far and expectations for demand. pic.twitter.com/HYTq5QNPt6 — Squawk on the Street (@SquawkStreet) January 19, 2024

Full story available on Benzinga.com
